intro: Sanicula menziesii var. pedata, commonly known as the broadleaf sanicula, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are broad, pinnately compound, and have a distinctive, fern-like appearance. The flowers are small, white to greenish in color, and are clustered in umbrella-shaped clusters, typical of the carrot family.
